title: John Lewis Christmas Brochure/Catalogue script font
content:
Has anyone seen the new John Lewis Christmas Brochure/Catalogue. I like the script font in particular [cover thumbnail](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201072859/http:/www.johnlewis.com/jl_assets/catalogue/08_xmas_giftbook.jpg) - sorry this image is so small - I will scan my hardcopy if I get a chance.

It has a similar retro feel to coquette by Mark Simonson

Thanks for any help from UK based typophiles.

 [‹ Halston Logo ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201072859/http:/typophile.com/node/51549 "Go to previous forum topic") [Two fonts from Gary Amoth Trucking ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201072859/http:/typophile.com/node/51547 "Go to next forum topic")
author: stretch76

comments.content:
the sample is small indeed. i’d still say it’s [Memimas Medium](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201072859/http:/www.type-o-tones.com/fonts.php?id=36).

hope this helps, even though i’m not UK based;-)

I think Dan is right. Though probably the [Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201072859/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/type_o_tones/memimas_bold/?sample_text=Christmas%20&sample_size=96) weight.
